about_the_game:
Experience the horror that many farmers dread: surviving a deadly tornado. 

Protect your farm, survive the storm.

Storm Burst: Tornado Alley is a single-player, replayable survival experience that pits players against nature. Race throughout the farmstead, and plan the most optimal way to secure your livelihood and your life against the perils of the incoming storm before it reaches your house. Complete as many objectives as you can, and get to the storm shelter before it's too late. Time is short. 

Unpredictable: Randomized weather and timing, including time of tornado touchdown, strength, speed and location.

Replayable: Randomized objectives keep the experience fresh.

Deadly: Dynamic debris will be an obstacle in your path. Tornados can pull you into the air. Plan accordingly to avert fatal consequences. 

Listen to the emergency broadcast and look to the clouds to determine your greatest path of success. Complete all your necessary tasks to secure the wellbeing of your farm, and your own safety! Turn off dangerous power and gas lines, seal the gas wells, release your farm animals, secure your home, and more as you race against the clock- all the while evading nature’s most fearsome threat. 

Now, batten down the hatches and get to the shelter!

content_descriptors.notes: This game includes some depictions of death and blood.

name: Storm Burst: Tornado Alley

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10
  • Processor: AMD FX-6300 or better
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: RX-470 or better
  • DirectX: Version 10
  • Storage: 10 GB available space
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10 64-bit (Version 20H2) or Better
  • Processor: Ryzen 3600 or better
  • Memory: 16 GB RAM
  • Graphics: RTX-2060 or better
  • DirectX: Version 12
  • Storage: 10 GB available space

short_description: Prepare and seek shelter as one of nature's most fearsome threats bears down on your farmstead. Cover ground as quickly as possible and attempt to survive the horror of the ever looming tornado danger.
